moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 g6: Sir George opens with a slow-paced defence against Menchik.
moves.3. Nc3 Bg7 4. e4 d6 5. f3 O-O: Book so far. Whate has more space in this variation but Black's K-side development is quicker.
moves.6. Be3 e5: Thomas tries to get a foothold in the center.
moves.9... Ne7: Thomas adds to his K-side defences.
moves.10. g4 Nd7 11. Rg1: Menchik forces the pace. She intends a powerful attack on Thomas' King.
moves.11... a5: Thomas has to carve out some space for himself before Menchik strangles his position.
moves.12. O-O-O Nc5 13. Ng3: Menchik ignores Thomas' Q-side thrust and prepares to smash open a road to his King.
moves.13... Bd7 14. h4 a4 15. h5: Contacting the enemy. Menchik will be able to force open a file.
moves.15... Qb8 16. Bh6: Removing the fianchettoed Bishop will cripple Thomas' K-side.
moves.16... Qa7 17. Bxg7 Kxg7: The King-hunt begins. Thomas can do little to stop it.
moves.18. Nf5+ Nxf5 19. gxf5: Now the Rook has an open avenue into Thomas' K-side.
moves.19... a3 20. f6+: If Thomas plays 20...KxP, 21 Q-N5ch is devastating.
moves.21... axb2+ 22. Kb1 Rfg8: To guard against the mate at his KN2. But...
moves.24. Qxh7+ Kxh7 25. Rh1+ Bh3 26. Rxh3#: Menchik shows that just as in every other aspect of life, women are also superior to men at chess... when they want to be.

gameName: A blow is struck for women
players: Vera Menchik  vs. Sir George Thomas
